user_input: Daniel has 7 boxes, and each box contains 9 items. He plans to buy 3 additional boxes with 8 items in each. If the total number of items exceeds 75, he will give away 5 items. Otherwise, he will keep them all.
Sophie has 15 flowers and plans to buy 5 bouquets with 3 flowers in each. If the total number of flowers exceeds 30 after buying, she will donate 6 flowers. Otherwise, she will keep them all.
James has 10 coins and decides to buy 4 sets, each containing 5 coins. If his total exceeds 40 coins, he will give away 8 coins. Otherwise, he will keep them all.

Alice has 6 baskets, each containing 8 fruits. She plans to buy 2 additional baskets with 5 fruits in each. If the total number of fruits exceeds 50, she will eat 4 fruits. Otherwise, she will keep them all.
Tom has 20 marbles and plans to buy 3 packs of 7 marbles each. If his total marbles exceed 50, he will give 10 marbles to his friend. Otherwise, he will keep them all.
Emma bought 4 boxes of crayons, each containing 6 crayons. She plans to buy 3 more boxes with 8 crayons each. If the total exceeds 50 crayons, she will give away 5. Otherwise, she will keep them all.
Mike has 12 pencils and decides to buy 4 packs of 5 pencils each. If his total exceeds 40 pencils, he will donate 6 pencils. Otherwise, he will keep them all.
Lily has 8 books and buys 6 more books. If her total exceeds 12 books, she will donate 3 books. Otherwise, she will keep them all.
John has 5 toy cars and buys 3 packs with 4 cars in each. If his total exceeds 20 cars, he will give away 2 cars. Otherwise, he will keep them all.
Nina has 30 stickers and plans to buy 2 sets with 12 stickers in each set. If her total stickers exceed 50, she will give 5 stickers to her friend. Otherwise, she will keep them all.
